item.title: Finished
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:92, topic:122975”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=172709.msg1630735#msg1630735 date=1185530068]

I’ll take a look at this and see if I can learn a thing or 2 from it.
[/quote]Don’t, by reading his sloppy coding all you’re doing is subjecting yourself to brain cell loss.

Actually fag, take a look at my coding and tell me if its sloppy. I’m a neat freak when it comes to coding alright, everything is perfectly indented, except for my GraphicsHandler because I didn’t want to take the time to fix it.

err, im sorry but i have to agree. theres more than just one aspect to considering the code… its not only how you format the file, but your overall program design and structure, as well as efficiency of it

Yes, I too hate this coding structure. I also hate it when people go like;
public class Bleh
{
They take a new line for every opening brace…

People who use eclipse usually have the following type format:

public class MyClass {
// fields and methods
}

But others (basically me) that use Visual J# will have a different format:

public class MyClass
{
// fields and methods
}

I like both formats personally, but the IDEs auto indent and format to their own kind.[/quote]

Uhm, don’t let an IDE format for you. >________________________>

Read full topic

item.title: Finished
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:91, topic:122975”][quote author=lawl link=topic=172709.msg1629691#msg1629691 date=1185503644]

I’ll take a look at this and see if I can learn a thing or 2 from it.
[/quote]Don’t, by reading his sloppy coding all you’re doing is subjecting yourself to brain cell loss.

Actually fag, take a look at my coding and tell me if its sloppy. I’m a neat freak when it comes to coding alright, everything is perfectly indented, except for my GraphicsHandler because I didn’t want to take the time to fix it.

err, im sorry but i have to agree. theres more than just one aspect to considering the code… its not only how you format the file, but your overall program design and structure, as well as efficiency of it

Yes, I too hate this coding structure. I also hate it when people go like;
public class Bleh
{
They take a new line for every opening brace… :/[/quote]

People who use eclipse usually have the following type format:

public class MyClass {
// fields and methods
}

But others (basically me) that use Visual J# will have a different format:

public class MyClass
{
// fields and methods
}

I like both formats personally, but the IDEs auto indent and format to their own kind.

item.title: Finished
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

lolz… i know

so… well i got an inventory system working… lol woot…

still working on dragging items

EIDIT:

Almost finished on dragging items atm
Works with any item inside of the invy, soon will get to work on items switching slots

EDIT2: Ok got item switching to work, now theres full inv… [br][size=1]Posted on: July 23, 2007, 04:44:17 PM[/size][hr]This project is over. I just wanted to get a feel of what it would be like to start my own RPG and I realized I need a team (2 people or 3)

So, I am going to put up my last upload with my source code and if you want to, you can take credit for that game. I DON’T GIVE A SHIT.

Alright download this game and leech FTW! - MegaUpload
